squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.locks

Class Symbol

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.locks.Symbol

  • public class Symbol
extends Object
    Represents a single key or lock within the lock-and-key puzzle.

    Each Symbol has a 'value'. Two Symbols are equivalent iff they have the same 'value'.

    • Field Detail

      • NOTHING

        public static final int NOTHING
        Symbol map with special meanings.

        Certain items (such as START, GOAL, BOSS) serve no purpose in the puzzle other than as markers for the client of the library to place special game objects.

        The SWITCH_ON and SWITCH_OFF symbols do not appear in rooms, only in Conditions and Edges.

        The SWITCH item does not give the player the SWITCH symbol, instead the player may choose to either

        • lose the SWITCH_OFF symbol (if they have it), and gain the SWITCH_ON symbol; or
        • lose the SWITCH_ON symbol (if they have it), and gain the SWITCH_OFF symbol.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • asChar

        public static char asChar(int value)
        Like toString(int), but returns one char instead, sometimes using some roguelike map conventions:
        • Symbol.START maps to '<'
        • Symbol.GOAL maps to '>'
        • Symbol.BOSS maps to '!'
        • Symbol.SWITCH maps to '&'
        • Symbol.SWITCH_ON maps to '1'
        • Symbol.SWITCH_OFF maps to '0'
        • Symbol.NOTHING maps to ' '
        • Any number between 0 and 255 inclusive is mapped to a letter using ArrayTools.letterAt(int)
        • Anything else maps to '*'
        Parameters:
        value - a symbol int that should be less than 256, and if negative should equal one of the Symbol constants
        Returns:
        a single char that can be used to identify value

      • toString

        public static String toString(int value)
        Gets a printable String representation of the int (the parameter value) that represents a symbol. START, GOAL, and BOSS map to "Start", "Goal", and "Boss", respectively. SWITCH, SWITCH_ON, and SWITCH_OFF map to "SW", "ON", and "OFF", respectively. NOTHING maps to "NO". Any number between 0 and 255 inclusive is mapped to a letter using ArrayTools.letterAt(int), and that becomes the returned String. Any other number is simply printed as a normal integer.
        Parameters:
        value - a symbol int that should be less than 256, and if negative should equal one of the Symbol constants
        Returns:
        a printable String that should match the meaning of value
